deck.name: Everyday Essentials
deck.description: Beginner-friendly deck covering greetings, present simple, basic questions and daily vocabulary.

cards.definition: a common way to ask about someone's well-being
cards.context: How are you? — I'm fine, thanks!

cards.definition: a polite phrase said when meeting someone for the first time
cards.context: Nice to meet you, I'm Sarah.

cards.definition: an informal way to say goodbye
cards.context: See you later, have a good day!

cards.definition: an informal way to ask how someone is
cards.context: Hey, how's it going? — Not bad, and you?

cards.definition: a very casual greeting meaning 'how are you' or 'what's happening'
cards.context: What's up? — Nothing much, just hanging out.

cards.definition: a friendly way to say goodbye, wishing someone well
cards.context: Take care, see you next week!

cards.definition: an informal way to wish someone a nice day
cards.context: Thanks for your help! — Have a good one!

cards.definition: said when you haven't seen someone for a while
cards.context: Long time no see! How have you been?

cards.definition: a slightly more formal way to greet someone new
cards.context: I'm David. Pleased to meet you.

cards.definition: an informal way to say goodbye
cards.context: I've got to go. Catch you later!

cards.definition: present simple of 'to live' — describes where you reside
cards.context: I live in a small apartment near the city center.

cards.definition: present simple of 'to work' — describes your job
cards.context: I work at a hospital as a nurse.

cards.definition: present simple expressing preference or enjoyment
cards.context: I like reading books before bed.

cards.definition: present simple of 'to go' — describes regular movement
cards.context: I go to the gym every Monday.

cards.definition: present simple of 'to eat' — describes eating habits
cards.context: I eat breakfast at seven o'clock.

cards.definition: present simple of 'to drink'
cards.context: I drink coffee every morning.

cards.definition: present simple of 'to speak'
cards.context: I speak French and a little English.

cards.definition: present simple of 'to have' — describes possession
cards.context: I have two brothers and one sister.

cards.definition: present simple of 'to need' — expresses necessity
cards.context: I need a glass of water, please.

cards.definition: present simple of 'to want' — expresses desire
cards.context: I want to learn English fluently.

cards.definition: third person present simple of 'to work'
cards.context: She works as a teacher in a primary school.

cards.definition: third person present simple of 'to like'
cards.context: He likes playing football on weekends.

cards.definition: third person present simple of 'to go'
cards.context: She goes to the supermarket every Saturday.

cards.definition: third person present simple of 'to have'
cards.context: He has a big dog named Max.

cards.definition: present simple of 'to play' in plural
cards.context: They play basketball after school.

cards.definition: used to make present simple sentences negative
cards.context: I don't like spicy food. She doesn't eat meat.

cards.definition: an adverb meaning every time, without exception
cards.context: I always brush my teeth before bed.

cards.definition: an adverb meaning most of the time
cards.context: I usually wake up at seven.

cards.definition: an adverb meaning occasionally, not always
cards.context: Sometimes I take the bus to work.

cards.definition: an adverb meaning not at any time
cards.context: I never drink alcohol.

cards.definition: a basic question to ask someone's name
cards.context: What is your name? — My name is Emma.

cards.definition: a question to ask about someone's origin
cards.context: Where are you from? — I'm from France.

cards.definition: a question to ask someone's age
cards.context: How old are you? — I'm twenty-five.

cards.definition: a question asking about someone's job or occupation
cards.context: What do you do? — I'm a software developer.

cards.definition: a yes/no question to ask about preferences
cards.context: Do you like chocolate? — Yes, I love it!

cards.definition: a question to ask about someone's home location
cards.context: Where do you live? — I live in Lyon.

cards.definition: a question to ask the current time
cards.context: What time is it? — It's half past three.

cards.definition: a question to ask the price of something
cards.context: How much is this? — It's ten euros.

cards.definition: a polite way to request something
cards.context: Can I have the bill, please?

cards.definition: a question to ask if someone speaks English
cards.context: Excuse me, do you speak English?

cards.definition: a question to ask about the location of something
cards.context: Is there a pharmacy nearby?

cards.definition: a polite request for assistance
cards.context: Can you help me? I'm looking for the train station.

cards.definition: the first meal of the day, eaten in the morning
cards.context: I have cereal and orange juice for breakfast.

cards.definition: the meal eaten in the middle of the day
cards.context: We usually have lunch around noon.

cards.definition: the main evening meal
cards.context: What are we having for dinner tonight?

cards.definition: a clear liquid essential for life
cards.context: Can I have a glass of water, please?

cards.definition: a baked food made from flour and water
cards.context: I buy fresh bread from the bakery every morning.

cards.definition: a white liquid produced by cows, used in drinks and cooking
cards.context: I put milk in my coffee.

cards.definition: the sweet part of a plant that contains seeds — apples, bananas, etc.
cards.context: I try to eat fruit every day.

cards.definition: a plant or part of a plant used as food — carrots, broccoli, etc.
cards.context: You should eat more vegetables.

cards.definition: a common type of poultry used as food
cards.context: We're having grilled chicken for dinner.

cards.definition: small white or brown grains used as a staple food
cards.context: I cook rice with almost every meal.

cards.definition: coins and notes used to buy things
cards.context: I don't have enough money for a taxi.

cards.definition: a place where you buy things
cards.context: The shop closes at eight o'clock.

cards.definition: a public road in a city or town
cards.context: The restaurant is on the next street.

cards.definition: a building where people live
cards.context: They just moved to a new house.

cards.definition: a road vehicle with four wheels and an engine
cards.context: I drive my car to work every day.

cards.definition: a large vehicle that carries passengers along a fixed route
cards.context: The bus to the city center leaves every 15 minutes.

cards.definition: a vehicle that runs on railway tracks
cards.context: I take the train to Paris once a month.

cards.definition: a device used to make calls or send messages
cards.context: I left my phone at home today.

cards.definition: a place where children go to learn
cards.context: My daughter starts school at eight thirty.

cards.definition: a place where sick or injured people receive medical treatment
cards.context: The hospital is about ten minutes from here.

cards.definition: a set of printed pages bound together for reading
cards.context: I'm reading a really good book right now.

cards.definition: the state of the atmosphere — sunny, rainy, cold, etc.
cards.context: The weather is beautiful today.

cards.definition: having a high temperature
cards.context: It's very hot outside today.

cards.definition: having a low temperature
cards.context: It's too cold to go swimming.

cards.definition: large in size
cards.context: They live in a big house with a garden.

cards.definition: little in size
cards.context: The café is small but very cozy.

cards.definition: of a high quality or standard
cards.context: This restaurant has really good food.

cards.definition: of poor quality or low standard
cards.context: The weather was bad all week.

cards.definition: feeling pleasure or contentment
cards.context: I'm so happy to see you!

cards.definition: feeling the need to rest or sleep
cards.context: I'm really tired after work today.

cards.definition: feeling the need to eat
cards.context: I'm hungry. Let's grab something to eat.

cards.definition: on this current day
cards.context: I have a meeting today at two.

cards.definition: on the day after today
cards.context: We're going to the beach tomorrow.

cards.definition: on the day before today
cards.context: I went to the cinema yesterday.

cards.definition: the early part of the day, before noon
cards.context: I go for a run every morning.

cards.definition: the part of the day between noon and evening
cards.context: The meeting is this afternoon at three.

cards.definition: the part of the day between afternoon and night
cards.context: We usually have dinner in the evening.

cards.definition: the time when it is dark outside
cards.context: I don't like walking alone at night.
